```{r}
x <- c(16, 16, 16, 16, 24, 24, 24, 24, 32, 32, 32, 32, 40, 40, 40, 40)
y <- c(199, 205, 196, 200, 218, 220, 215, 223, 237, 234, 235, 230, 250, 248, 253, 246)

x.n <- length(x)

y.b <- mean(y)
x.b <- mean(x)

n <- sum((x - x.b) * y)
d <- sum((x - x.b) ** 2)

b1 <- n / d
b0 <- y.b - x.b * b1

y_fitted <- b0 + b1 * x

residual <- y - y_fitted

mse <- sum(residual ** 2) / (x.n - 2)

s_b1_squared <- mse / d

t1 <- b1 / sqrt(s_b1_squared)

p <- (1 - pt(t1, x.n - 2, ncp = 0)) * 2

# Fit linear regression model
model <- lm(y ~ x)

# Obtain summary statistics
summary(model)
```

The $y$ values are `r y`.

The $x$ values are `r x`.

Our $y$ fitted values are `r y_fitted`.

Given $\alpha$, if the $p$ value is smaller than $\alpha$ (type I error), we reject the null hypothesis.

The $p$ value is $`r p`$.
